text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HAARETZ
- One dead and 66 wounded in bridge collapse at opening of Maccabiah games.
- Palestinian police detained on their way to attack at Jewish settlement.
- Two civilians dead after Israeli army fired on village in south Lebanon.
- Finance Minister Neeman will recommend immediate budget cut of 600 million shekels.
- Two IsraAir pilots suspended after leaving cockpit during flight.
- 1,1770 young women victims of systematic sexual exploitation in Israel.
JERUSALEM POST
- Prime Minister warns of "strong action" on Hebron.
- Merrill Lynch purchases 12.5 percent stake in Bezeq.
- Netanyahu, Neeman, Frenkel to discuss budget today.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Disgrace at Maccabiah opening.
MAARIV
- Effort to resuscitate casualties at bridge tragedy.
GLOBES
- Full competition in the credit card market: all the banks will issue all the cards.
- Strike at Bezeq after sale of 12.4 percent of shares to Merrill Lynch.
- Netanyahu backs immediate 600 million shekel cut in 1997 budget and additional cut in 1998.
